questions.question: What is the time complexity of binary search on a sorted array?
questions.explanation: Binary search halves the search space each step, resulting in O(log n) time complexity.

questions.question: What is a prerequisite for performing binary search?
options: The array must contain unique elements
The array must have an even number of elements
The array must be stored in contiguous memory
questions.explanation: Binary search requires the data to be sorted so it can eliminate half the remaining elements at each step.

questions.question: In binary search, if the target is less than the middle element, where do you search next?
questions.explanation: Since the array is sorted, if the target is less than the middle, it must be in the left (lower) half.
